result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James E. Penrod Jr.

records.addlTxt:
11:43 AM Defendant James E. Penrod Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Corcoran in court for James E. Penrod Jr.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne in court for State of Wisconsin.   Clerk HM.    No objection to DE's appearance by zoom today.  Amended Information filed. Reading waived.  DE enters NC plea.  Court finds DE guilty.  PSI ordered. SEH 1/26 2pm. Bond continued.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

9:59 AM Defendant James E. Penrod Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Corcoran in court for James E. Penrod Jr.  Attorney Burgoyne in court for State of Wisconsin.  Clerk HM.   Matter not resolved yet.  Global offer made.  22CF505 is set for trial and this case trails.  Bond continued.

Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Corcoran.   Clerk HMcBride.  DE's motion to modify bond to a SB or lower CB.  State objects.  Court hears argument.  Court denies motion.  Trial set.  JSH 10/27 11am. JS 11/14 830am.   22CF176 trails.
Final pre-trial on October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.  This case has been assigned to Judge Dougvillo.  Date and time remained the same.
